name: CodeSystem
description: The CodeSystem resource is used to declare the existence of and describe a code system or code system supplement and its key properties, and optionally define a part or all of its content.

elements.name: id
elements.short: Logical id of this artifact
elements.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

elements.name: meta
elements.short: Metadata about the resource
elements.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: implicitRules
elements.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
elements.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: language
elements.short: Language of the resource content
elements.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: text
elements.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
elements.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: contained
elements.short: Contained, inline Resources
elements.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.

elements.name: extension
elements.short: Additional content defined by implementations
elements.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: modifierExtension
elements.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored
elements.description:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: url
elements.short: Canonical identifier for this code system, represented as a URI (globally unique) (Coding.system)
elements.description: An absolute URI that is used to identify this code system when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which at which an authoritative instance of this code system is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the code system is stored on different servers. This is used in [Coding](datatypes.html#Coding).system.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: identifier
elements.short: Additional identifier for the code system (business identifier)
elements.description: A formal identifier that is used to identify this code system when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: version
elements.short: Business version of the code system (Coding.version)
elements.description: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the code system when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the code system author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence. This is used in [Coding](datatypes.html#Coding).version.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: name
elements.short: Name for this code system (computer friendly)
elements.description: A natural language name identifying the code system. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: title
elements.short: Name for this code system (human friendly)
elements.description: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the code system.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: status
elements.short: draft | active | retired | unknown
elements.description: The date (and optionally time) when the code system resource was created or revised.

binding.description: The lifecycle status of an artifact.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: experimental
elements.short: For testing purposes, not real usage
elements.description: A Boolean value to indicate that this code system is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: date
elements.short: Date last changed
elements.description: The date  (and optionally time) when the code system was published. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the code system changes.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: publisher
elements.short: Name of the publisher (organization or individual)
elements.description: The name of the organization or individual that published the code system.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: contact
elements.short: Contact details for the publisher
elements.description: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: description
elements.short: Natural language description of the code system
elements.description: A free text natural language description of the code system from a consumer's perspective.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: useContext
elements.short: The context that the content is intended to support
elements.description: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate code system instances.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: jurisdiction
elements.short: Intended jurisdiction for code system (if applicable)
elements.description: A legal or geographic region in which the code system is intended to be used.

binding.description: Countries and regions within which this artifact is targeted for use.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: purpose
elements.short: Why this code system is defined
elements.description: Explanation of why this code system is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: copyright
elements.short: Use and/or publishing restrictions
elements.description: A copyright statement relating to the code system and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the code system.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: caseSensitive
elements.short: If code comparison is case sensitive
elements.description: If code comparison is case sensitive when codes within this system are compared to each other.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: valueSet
elements.short: Canonical reference to the value set with entire code system
elements.description: Canonical reference to the value set that contains the entire code system.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: hierarchyMeaning
elements.short: grouped-by | is-a | part-of | classified-with
elements.description: The meaning of the hierarchy of concepts as represented in this resource.

binding.description: The meaning of the hierarchy of concepts in a code system.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: compositional
elements.short: If code system defines a compositional grammar
elements.description: The code system defines a compositional (post-coordination) grammar.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: versionNeeded
elements.short: If definitions are not stable
elements.description: This flag is used to signify that the code system does not commit to concept permanence across versions. If true, a version must be specified when referencing this code system.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: content
elements.short: not-present | example | fragment | complete | supplement
elements.description: The extent of the content of the code system (the concepts and codes it defines) are represented in this resource instance.

binding.description: The extent of the content of the code system (the concepts and codes it defines) are represented in a code system resource.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: supplements
elements.short: Canonical URL of Code System this adds designations and properties to
elements.description: The canonical URL of the code system that this code system supplement is adding designations and properties to.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: count
elements.short: Total concepts in the code system
elements.description: The total number of concepts defined by the code system. Where the code system has a compositional grammar, the basis of this count is defined by the system steward.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: filter
elements.short: Filter that can be used in a value set
elements.description: A filter that can be used in a value set compose statement when selecting concepts using a filter.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: id
elements.short: Unique id for inter-element referencing
elements.description: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

elements.name: extension
elements.short: Additional content defined by implementations
elements.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.description:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: code
elements.short: Code that identifies the filter
elements.description: The code that identifies this filter when it is used as a filter in [ValueSet](valueset.html#).compose.include.filter.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: description
elements.short: How or why the filter is used
elements.description: A description of how or why the filter is used.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: operator
elements.short: = | is-a | descendent-of | is-not-a | regex | in | not-in | generalizes | exists
elements.description: A list of operators that can be used with the filter.

binding.description: The kind of operation to perform as a part of a property based filter.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: value
elements.short: What to use for the value
elements.description: A description of what the value for the filter should be.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: property
elements.short: Additional information supplied about each concept
elements.description: A property defines an additional slot through which additional information can be provided about a concept.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.short: Unique id for inter-element referencing
elements.description: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

elements.name: code
elements.short: Identifies the property on the concepts, and when referred to in operations
elements.description: A code that is used to identify the property. The code is used internally (in CodeSystem.concept.property.code) and also externally, such as in property filters.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: uri
elements.short: Formal identifier for the property
elements.description: Reference to the formal meaning of the property. One possible source of meaning is the [Concept Properties](codesystem-concept-properties.html) code system.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: description
elements.short: Why the property is defined, and/or what it conveys
elements.description: A description of the property- why it is defined, and how its value might be used.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: type
elements.short: code | Coding | string | integer | boolean | dateTime | decimal
elements.description: The type of the property value. Properties of type "code" contain a code defined by the code system (e.g. a reference to another defined concept).

binding.description: The type of a property value.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: concept
elements.short: Concepts in the code system
elements.description: Concepts that are in the code system. The concept definitions are inherently hierarchical, but the definitions must be consulted to determine what the meanings of the hierarchical relationships are.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: code
elements.short: Code that identifies concept
elements.description: A code - a text symbol - that uniquely identifies the concept within the code system.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: display
elements.short: Text to display to the user
elements.description: A human readable string that is the recommended default way to present this concept to a user.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: definition
elements.short: Formal definition
elements.description: The formal definition of the concept. The code system resource does not make formal definitions required, because of the prevalence of legacy systems. However, they are highly recommended, as without them there is no formal meaning associated with the concept.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: designation
elements.short: Additional representations for the concept
elements.description: Additional representations for the concept - other languages, aliases, specialized purposes, used for particular purposes, etc.

elements.name: language
elements.short: Human language of the designation
elements.description: The language this designation is defined for.

elements.name: use
elements.short: Details how this designation would be used
elements.description: A code that details how this designation would be used.

binding.description: Details of how a designation would be used.

elements.short: The text value for this designation
elements.description: The text value for this designation.

elements.description: The value of this property.

elements.name: concept
elements.short: Child Concepts (is-a/contains/categorizes)
elements.description: Defines children of a concept to produce a hierarchy of concepts. The nature of the relationships is variable (is-a/contains/categorizes) - see hierarchyMeaning.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
